intro: Senecio valparadisiensis, commonly known as the Valparaíso groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb with erect, branching stems that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
